Ok i get it now. The 2nd last panel is a flashback. It recalls why she calls MC "Nii-chan" then jumps back to present time. With this in mind, fuck this manga. She loves her eldest brother so much, she rather trick herself into believing her only "Nii-chan" die instead.

There's two ways of looking at this. During the funeral she's in shock then snaps due to heartbreak while alone in her room and projects Nao onto MC.

Or two. She doesn't actually care for "Nii-chan" at all. Her playing games with him is more out of pity than her enjoyment of his company. This would make sense since she gets so much more joy out of being in "Nao's" company as well as her devastated look from the bad news and you typically wouldn't be fond of assholes. Since MC is dead there's no way he could be standing in her room so who else to replace him with than Nao who just so happens to be dead.

I feel bad for MC. Despite it all, he doesn't want to be dead to her, but he is and their relationship is lost too.

Who Died? The answer I believe to be true is that Nao died and this question is being asked to the little sister. Probably due to disbelief and suffering from the shock of Nao dying she instead fooled herself in believing it was nii-chan/Nobu instead. This is supported by the fact that in the Doujin we see the funeral photo of Nao and his light colored hair, however on the cover art for the doujin we see the imouto holding a funeral photo with what appears to be a boy with black hair, Nobu. So to sum it up as to who died, Nao indeed died however imouto fooled herself in believing it was Nobu who died instead.

Most of these explanations seem vague, so let me try this.
The MC is the middle brother, his older brother was a douchebag, and his younger sister was great, he loved her, however she was having sex (in love with) the oldest brother, after his death she breaks and sees the middle brother as the oldest and fucks him. It's shit and depressing.

This is a very deep story, there was heartbreak, drama,  romance, and a ton more emotions. This story was better than the hunger games books, it deserves a reward.

Frankly, I feel that the worst part is that, despite the whole cucked by older brother shit, it's the sister that makes it worse for me. As she actively wishes her "brother" was dead by substituting him for Nao Or her Lover. She would much rather have her lover-brother, than her brother-brother. The One who seemed to actively care for her in any capacity. The older brother seems like he may have instigated in his sexual relationship with the sister in order to spite our MC, seeing how much of a dick he is. Which sucks when in the end she wishes she still had him over the one she recognised as a brother.

This is depressing as fuck. Dude lost the one thing that was undeniably his in order to become a substitute for someone he hated while she says things that can essentially be quite hurtful in the moment while thinking she's being nice "I love you nao more than anyone in the world!". She didn't treat Nao like a brother, to her he probably wasn't one. But MC was. It might not have been the relationship he wanted from her, but it was safe and secure. He could be content knowing at least she loved him quite a lot. Now she's all confused and considers him Nao. Once the novelty wears off (you can see it already is starting to by the end), it's going to begin to really eat him up inside.

I know this type of coping behavior in similar cases of shock in people, but I don't know if it's specifically named something... It's obviously psychological though... Ah! That's it, "Capgras delusion"! No wait... that mental ilness has the victim delude themselves into thinking someone close to them has been replaced by an identical imposter... hmm then it must be... Yes, yes it must be a case of "Dissociative Amnesia". Though this theory would leave a fairly sizable margin for error considering the lack of evidence on wether their bond was strong enough to become a pseudo type of RAD; but the loss of her loved one is a event traumatic enough to set DA in order. But if I am somewhat right, this Dissociative Amnesia proved to have been serious enough to  induce a monothematic delusion in our heroin which causes her believe her loved one is still alive. Almost like the Fregoli delusion, but not quite.
